title: Redesign Mission Control UI with new design system
problem: Current Mission Control UI needs to match the new design specification provided by Logan. The UI must be fully functional with real data from our APIs, not placeholders.
scope:
Update src/pages/MissionControl.tsx to implement the new design with:
- Agent status strip (compact/expanded modes based on active agents)
- Kanban columns (proposed, queued, development, review, done)
- Blocked tasks bar (collapsible)
- Activity feed sidebar
- Task cards with priority dots, tags, and owner indicators
- Real-time data from /api/tasks, /api/agents, /api/live, /api/activity
- DM Sans font from Google Fonts
- Exact colors and styling from reference file
acceptanceCriteria: Agent strip shows expanded cards when <4 active, compact mode when >=4 active
All data comes from real API endpoints (no mock data)
Task cards show priority (P0/P1/P2/P3) with correct colors
Task cards show tags (Epic, UI, Backend, QA, etc.) with correct colors
Blocked tasks bar is collapsible and shows all blocked tasks
Activity feed shows recent events from /api/activity
Navigation bar matches design (Mission Control, Projects, Activity, etc.)
Board header shows total tasks, critical count, blocked count
Column overflow shows +N more button when >5 tasks
All styling matches reference file exactly (colors, spacing, borders, shadows)
Code pushed to GitHub and Docker container updated
